alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 26 at 3:00PM PST until February 27 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory above 2000 feet, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 15 inches in valley locations with 20 to 40 inches in higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, the lower I-5 passes north of Grants Pass and the Kalmiopsis Wilderness. For the Winter Storm Warning, the I-5 passes north of Grants Pass, including the Kalmiopsis Wilderness, Bear Camp Road, and highway 199 from Hayes Hill Summit southward. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, the higher terrain around the Applegate Valley, including a portion of Route 238 between Murphy and Provolt. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Tuesday. For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 AM to 1 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rates could reach an inch per hour in higher terrain Monday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
